page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: There are 16 farms in the area,6 are dairy,7 mixed,2 arable and 1 partly mechanised. {The dairy farms}mainly milk Freisian/Holstein,but there is one farm in Sheepy milking Shorthorns.The milking parlours use pipelines direct to the milk tank and the Milk Marketing Board collects the milk using tanker lorries.Herd sizes fall between 50 to 100 requiring 1 person and an assistant to milk. {Market prices,}cull cows Â£500 to Â£600,newly calfed heifers about Â£700,bull calves up to Â£150 and heifer calves about Â£70.Most dairy farms grow hay sillage and a few cereals, the land in the area lends itself to good grass leys esecially near the river courses.
